acidity.notes: Overwhelming, puckery, like a very tart apple.

sweetness.notes: Very little, if any, sweetness to balance the acidity.

body.notes: Body is pleasant. Between tea-like and light syrup texture.

finish.notes: Aftertaste feels and tastes a bit like that of having cheap coffee and being left with bad breath. Mouth is definitely dry.

flavor: Predominately the fruit note, but in an overwhelmingly tangy way. Like the last brew, the notes actually diminish as the coffee cools. Mouth is left very dry, indicating overextraction.
observations: Extremely slow drawdown. Had to force stop at 4 minutes.
actionItem: Reduce bloom swirl to 2–3 seconds and/or pour faster after bloom. The technique I'm using pre-pour is consistently pushing time by 30–60 seconds. Either the bloom swirl is too vigorous or too long or the pour is too gentle.
